section.title: as ... as and describing quantity
section.sectiontitle: We use as + adjective/adverb/much/many + as to say that two things are similar in some way.
section.text1a: My car is as expensive as yours.
section.text2a: I visit my parents as often as I can.
section.sectiontitle2: We often put possible/ever/usual after the second as.
section.text3a: Oxford Street was as crowded as usual.
section.text4a: The last time we went to the restaurant the food was as wonderful as ever.

section.title: as ... as and describing quantity
section.sectiontitle: We can use as ... as to show that something is surprising.
section.text1a: For as little as £4.95 a month, you can become a member of the club!
section.text2: I tried to call you ten times!
section.text2a: As many as that? I only got two messages.
